title: Bachelor's Degrees in the United States
question_text: Chances are, since you are studying AP Statistics, you plan to earn at least a bachelor's degree from college.  According to the U.S. Census Bureau, $29\%$ of Americans age $25\text{ years}$ or older have already earned a bachelor's or more advanced degree.  You decide to randomly select $58\text{ adults}$ over the age of $25$ to ask if they have earned at least a bachelor's degree. Describe the sampling distribution of the proportion of respondents who have earned at least a bachelor's degree.

choices.text: The sampling distribution is nearly normal. μ ^ p = 0.29 μ p ^ = 0.29 σ ^ p = 0.06 σ p ^ = 0.06
The sampling distribution is nearly normal. μ ^ p = 0.29 μ p ^ = 0.29 σ ^ p = 0.008 σ p ^ = 0.008
The sampling distribution is not nearly normal. μ ^ p = 0.29 μ p ^ = 0.29 σ ^ p = 0.06 σ p ^ = 0.06
The sampling distribution is not nearly normal. μ ^ p = 0.29 μ p ^ = 0.29 σ ^ p = 0.008 σ p ^ = 0.008
The sampling distribution is not nearly normal. μ ^ p = 0.29 μ p ^ = 0.29 σ ^ p = 0.09 σ p ^ = 0.09
